org.knime.core.node.port.database

Class DatabaseReaderConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.node.port.database.DatabaseReaderConnection
  • Deprecated. 
    use DatabaseUtility.getReader(DatabaseQueryConnectionSettings) instead

    @Deprecated
public final class DatabaseReaderConnection
extends Object
    Creates a connection to read from database.
    Author:
    Thomas Gabriel, University of Konstanz

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DatabaseReaderConnection.RowIteratorConnection
      Deprecated. 
      A row iterator that holds an open database connection and allows to create an iterator that iterates through the database entries and return them as a data row.

    • Field Detail

      • SQL_QUERY_SEPARATOR

        @Deprecated
public static final String SQL_QUERY_SEPARATOR
        Deprecated. 
        Separator used to decided which SQL statements should be execute line-by-line; the semicolon is not part of the executed query. We need the \n in addition to the semicolon to ensure that commands that contain a ; are handled correctly!
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Parameters:

        Deprecated. 
        Returns the database meta data on the connection.

        Throws:

      • createTable

        public BufferedDataTable createTable(ExecutionContext exec,
                                     CredentialsProvider cp,
                                     boolean useDbRowId)
                              throws CanceledExecutionException,
                                     SQLException
        Deprecated. 
        Read data from database.
        Parameters:
        exec - used for progress info
        cp - CredentialsProvider providing user/password
        useDbRowId - true if the row id returned by the database should be used to generate the KNIME row id
        Returns:
        buffered data table read from database
        Throws:
        CanceledExecutionException - if canceled in between
        SQLException - if the connection could not be opened
        Since:
        2.12

      • createRowIteratorConnection

        public DatabaseReaderConnection.RowIteratorConnection createRowIteratorConnection(ExecutionContext exec,
                                                                                  CredentialsProvider cp,
                                                                                  boolean useDbRowId)
                                                                           throws SQLException
        Deprecated. 
        Read data from database using a RowIterator.
        Parameters:
        exec - used for progress info
        cp - CredentialsProvider providing user/password
        useDbRowId - true if the row id returned by the database should be used to generate the KNIME row id
        Returns:
        an object that represents the open database connection. The individual entries are accessible by means of a RowIterator.
        Throws:
        CanceledExecutionException - if canceled in between
        SQLException - if the connection could not be opened
        Since:
        3.1

      • createTable

        DataTable createTable(int cachedNoRows,
                      CredentialsProvider cp)
               throws SQLException
        Deprecated. 
        Called from the database port to read the first n-number of rows.
        Parameters:
        cachedNoRows - number of rows cached for data preview
        cp - CredentialsProvider providing user/password
        Returns:
        buffered data table read from database
        Throws:
        SQLException - if the connection could not be opened
